transcripts.text: Please describe to the court in detail exactly what you witnessed on the night of November 14.
Well, I roused in the night to do my mid-sleep chores.  The night sewing and the night milking and gutting rabbits in the night.  when upon returning through the Lee, I did spy upon Goody Hobbs.
Can you indicate the presence of said Goody Hobbs in this court?
Aye.  It is she.  EO Mary.  Oh, hello, Goody.
Hello.  Let the record show that Miss Ipswich has identified Goody Hobbs, who is currently housed in the witch's stocks.
In the lee, there she was, sitting on a log, completely alone, bathed in moonlight and the cool night air.
And how was she occupying herself?
Well, that's the queer thing.  She wasn't.  She didn't appear to be engaged in any activity of any kind.  She was just sitting there.  Repugnant!
I told you, I was just having a wee sit.  Silence, you hysterical beast!  Copy that.  Perhaps communing with the devil?
Perhaps.  In truth, her mind might have been wandering utterly anywhere.  She seemed to be occupied with... Oh, it feels dreadfully wicked even to say it.
Free time!  Alone in her women's thoughts.  Witchery!  She was not night-sowing or night-mending or night-birthing?  None of those things whatsoever.  And how did witnessing this make you feel?
I suppose it made me feel...
envious.  Envy!  A cardinal sin!
It just seems so nice to have a little, you know, I don't know, me time.  I was just sitting on a log looking at the night mist.

You know, and just letting my mind wonder what's the mist and where'd it come from and imagining what else it looked like.  And then I started thinking about my stomach and how I was getting a bit peckish.  Maybe I should eat some food later.

You wicked demon!  Straight from hell!  Would you she-devils please stop interrupting the men's hubbub?  Yes.  For admitting to the cardinal sin of envy, I hereby sentence Mary Ipswich to also be held in the stocks.

No.  Please, sir.  No.  Here comes Mary.  I'm so sorry.  I didn't mean to fail.  No, no.  Oh, I am so sorry, goody.  Oh, no need to apologize, Mary.  This is the most down time I've had since I was a wee babe.
It's true.  I'm almost relaxed.  One can't even knit in these things.
No, you just get to sit and have a bit of a think and a stare.

You can't do anything?  I'm envious.  I'll go in the stock.  No, I as well.  Me too.  I am so envious.  Get away.  Get away from me.  I'll see you in hell, I suppose.  Well, at least it's heated there.  Nice and cozy.
Nice and cozy.
Thank you.
